title: What are some good podcasts on Spotify? - Quora

response.answer_text: As is often the case, it depends what you mean by “best”. Spotify hosts many of the podcasts that are popular or acclaimed on other platforms. For example, “Welcome to Night Vale”, “Waking Up with Sam Harris”, and “My Brother, My Brother, and Me” are all available on Spotify. If you want to listen to good podcasts and Spotify is your preferred platform, use a general list of quality podcasts; they are probably on Spotify. You might also browse the Spotify podcasts section by genre to narrow your search. Alternatively we might be interested in podcasts that are unique to Spotify (produced by Spotify, perhaps). In that case our options are limited, but only because Spotify got into this game relatively recently. They are collaborating with at least a couple big-time podcasting networks (Gimlet and Panoply) to produce “Mogul” and “Show Stoppers”, so I would imagine they will expand their stable quickly if these shows are successful.

Stuff You Should Know- this is a very informative podcast that covers many, many topics. Very entertaining.Welcome to Nightvale- this is a very surreal podcast. The less you know the better. Start at episode 1.Stuff You Missed in History Class- this is a history podcast that covers history topics. My favorite episodes are the series regarding John Wilks Booth.WTF with Marc Maron- comedian Marc Marron and his pessimist personality interviews the most interesting people on the planet— including President Obama.
